text:
- Tyler Technologies is the
largest software company
exclusively focused on the public sector.
As we continue to grow,
and we talk about disaster recovery,

and unrecoverable disaster from
an entire physical location,
it can be time intensive.
There's a lot of risk areas.
And so we are starting to get to the scale

as we looked at 4,000, 5,000,
6,000 virtual machines,
where we were really concerned
about my recovery point objective,
not to mention, kind of the cost factor

of I've gotta buy all
this duplicate hardware
to move into this other physical location.
Using Elastic Disaster Recovery,
and using it over the last several years,
they're really two primary areas
that we're able to accomplish.

The first is we run it inside
of our private data center,

so we were able to remove
a lot of other applications

and switch to just a
cloud-based disaster recovery
that gave us improved RPO, RTO.

We've actually automated
it to run the entire thing

with a single click of a button
for an entire data center.
The second area has been in Cloud Native,
so actually running inside AWS
for an application that's running
in a single availability zone,
we can actually get that disaster recovery

to another area inside
the same AWS region.

We're able to actually
run this, and we've found
that it's the 12X improvement
from an RPO and RTO perspective
to what we were running before.
It's pretty impressive when a customer

who's feeling very nervous
about a Go Live, can sit there

and see the technology that'll
allow their systems to run

in other areas of the
country within minutes.
(upbeat music)
